thread.title: Wall St. dips at the open on China concerns
thread.title_full: Wall St. dips at the open on China concerns

title: Wall St. dips at the open on China concerns
text:
Wall St. dips at the open on China concerns 22 minutes ago . View photo A trader works on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange shortly after the opening bell in New York, July 23, 2015. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson 
(Reuters) - U.S. stocks opened lower on Monday after an increased selloff in Shanghai shares sparked concerns over China's slowing growth. 
The Dow Jones industrial average (.DJI) fell 85.92 points, or 0.49 percent, to 17,482.61, the S&P 500 (.SPX) lost 7.68 points, or 0.37 percent, to 2,071.97 and the Nasdaq composite (.IXIC) dropped 35.26 points, or 0.69 percent, to 5,053.37. 
(Reporting by Narottam Medhora in Bengaluru; Editing by Don Sebastian) Stocks & Offerings
